InteractionDesign.Group3

Class APIClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • InteractionDesign.Group3.APIClient

  • public class APIClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an interface for fetching weather data and location search suggestions. Weather data from the openweathermap API. (https://openweathermap.org/) Search suggestions from a local file

    • Method Detail

      • currentWeatherAtCity

        public WeatherData currentWeatherAtCity(java.lang.String location)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the current weather data at a particular city, from the city name.
        Parameters:
        location - the name of a city, and its ISO 3166 country code, separated by a comma eg. "London, GB"
        Returns:
        details of the current weather in that location
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the API request fails

      • currentWeatherAtCity

        public WeatherData currentWeatherAtCity(int cityID)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the current weather data at a particular city, from the city ID. City IDs are defined by openweather map. They are listed at http://openweathermap.org/help/city_list.txt
        Parameters:
        cityID - the city ID
        Returns:
        details of the current weather in that location
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the API request fails

      • forecastWeatherAtCity

        public java.util.List<WeatherForecast> forecastWeatherAtCity(java.lang.String location)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the 5 day weather forecast for a particular city, from the city name. City IDs are defined by openweather map. They are listed at http://openweathermap.org/help/city_list.txt
        Parameters:
        location - the name of a city, and its ISO 3166 country code, separated by a comma eg. "London, GB"
        Returns:
        details of the weather forecast in that location
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the API request fails

      • forecastWeatherAtCity

        public java.util.List<WeatherForecast> forecastWeatherAtCity(int cityID)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the 5 day weather forecast for a particular city, from the city ID. City IDs are defined by openweather map. They are listed at http://openweathermap.org/help/city_list.txt
        Parameters:
        cityID - the city ID
        Returns:
        details of the weather forecast in that location
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the API request fails
